com.hazelcast.internal.diagnostics

Class Diagnostics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.diagnostics.Diagnostics

  • public class Diagnostics
extends Object
    The Diagnostics is a debugging tool that provides insight in all kinds of potential performance and stability issues. The actual logic to provide such insights, is placed in the DiagnosticsPlugin.

    • Field Detail

      • PREFIX

        public static final String PREFIX
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • METRICS_LEVEL

        public static final HazelcastProperty METRICS_LEVEL
        The minimum level for probes is MANDATORY, but it can be changed to INFO or DEBUG. A lower level will increase memory usage (probably just a few 100KB) and provides much greater detail on what is going on inside a HazelcastInstance.

        By default only mandatory probes are being tracked

      • METRICS_DISTRIBUTED_DATASTRUCTURES

        public static final HazelcastProperty METRICS_DISTRIBUTED_DATASTRUCTURES
        If metrics should be tracked on distributed data structures like IMap, IQueue etc.

        By default, these data structures are not tracked, but in a future release this will probably be changed to true.

      • ENABLED

        public static final HazelcastProperty ENABLED
        Use the Diagnostics to see internal performance metrics and cluster related information.

        The performance monitor logs all metrics into the log file.

        For more detailed information, please check the METRICS_LEVEL.

        The default is false.

      • MAX_ROLLED_FILE_SIZE_MB

        public static final HazelcastProperty MAX_ROLLED_FILE_SIZE_MB
        The DiagnosticsLogFile uses a rolling file approach to prevent eating too much disk space.

        This property sets the maximum size in MB for a single file.

        Every HazelcastInstance will get its own history of log files.

        The default is 50.

      • MAX_ROLLED_FILE_COUNT

        public static final HazelcastProperty MAX_ROLLED_FILE_COUNT
        The DiagnosticsLogFile uses a rolling file approach to prevent eating too much disk space.

        This property sets the maximum number of rolling files to keep on disk.

        The default is 10.

      • INCLUDE_EPOCH_TIME

        public static final HazelcastProperty INCLUDE_EPOCH_TIME
        Configures if the epoch time should be included in the 'top' section. This makes it easy to determine the time in epoch format and prevents needing to parse the date-format section. The default is false since it will cause more noise.

      • DIRECTORY

        public static final HazelcastProperty DIRECTORY
        Configures the output directory of the performance log files.

        Defaults to the 'user.dir'.

      • FILENAME_PREFIX

        public static final HazelcastProperty FILENAME_PREFIX
        Configures the prefix for the diagnostics file.

        So instead of having e.g. 'diagnostics-...log' you get 'foobar-diagnostics-...log'.

    • Method Detail

      • currentFile

        public File currentFile()

      • getPlugin

        public <P extends DiagnosticsPlugin> P getPlugin(Class<P> pluginClass)
        Gets the plugin for a given plugin class. This method should be used if the plugin instance is required within some data-structure outside of the Diagnostics.
        Type Parameters:
        P - type of the plugin
        Parameters:
        pluginClass - the class of the DiagnosticsPlugin
        Returns:
        the DiagnosticsPlugin found, or null if not active

      • register

        public void register(DiagnosticsPlugin plugin)
        Registers a DiagnosticsPlugin.

        This method is thread-safe.

        There is no checking for duplicate registration.

        If the Diagnostics is disabled, the call is ignored.

        Parameters:
        plugin - the plugin to register
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if plugin is null

      • start

        public void start()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
